I tried their Salmon sandwich -- tasty and not too heavy. I don't think I've ever really had a Salmon sandwich before and definitely not one with both smoked and baked Salmon. But it turned out to be a combination that surprisingly works well together. And the service was fast and friendly in spite of what appeared to be a micro-kitchen.  Looking forward to trying some of their other sandwiches soon!
author: Vivek P.

description: UPDATE: The Sandwiches are INCREDIBLE. I met a visiting friend for lunch last week. I got the trout sandwich, she got the turkey meatloaf & we pulled a halvsies sandwich swap. Both were superb. The Sentinel is probably the best $8 sandwich spot you're gonna find anywhere.
author: Pete J.

description: Everyone is right about the corned beef sandwich with russian dressing.  This isn't your average over boiled, over fatty, over salty kind of corned beef.  It's lean, sliced thin.  It's different, definitely delicious.
author: K W.

description: so, i really don't know what the big deal is. I got the corned beef sandwich and it came with the smallest amount of meat i've ever gotten on a sandwich in my life. $8.50 for this? you've got to be kidding. sure, they're nice, but come on, if i'm paying nearly ten dollars for a sandwich at least either give me some chips or put enough stuff on it so i'm full.
author: mm ..

description:
The chicken salad sandwich has a hint of chili and makes my mouth water.
Also, everyday their soups are delicious! Yum.
author: Mindy G.

description:
Best muffins I've ever had. Makes it hard to eat other muffins.

Pear. Strawberry pear. Blueberry. Pineapple. Squash. I can't decide which one I like best. They're all amazing. Haven't tried the sandwiches, maybe I will someday.
author: Josh K.

description: I just elected to skip a free bagel breakfast at work and see what all the fuss was about with The Sentinel's muffins. Oh. My. GOD. I'm eating a warm sour cherry muffin right now. I may have died and gone to heaven. Wow. Just...wow. You know how muffins from "those other places" are often lacking in the fruity or nutty goodness that all but makes the muffin? Not so here. This muffin is well over 50% fruit. I will definitely be going back for lunch. Maybe today.
author: Jasmine F.

description:
Sometimes you can judge a place by it's cover; The Sentinel is a welcomed addition to the FiDi; I went early; I heard raves about the Salmon sandwich; and the chief ingredient that sold me on this sandwich was the green tomato.  It was a nice, sweet, tart and great balance to the protein and oil in the salmon.  The menu board read "brioche" so I was also sold on that taste dynamic; I got my sandwich and went a few block; voila... open box and thick light rye bread.  A bit disappointed I was undeterred and truly enjoyed the sensible size; full of natural flavors; Dennis Leary was behind the counter; he is a Chef's Chef--calm, seemingly detached from everything except the food; I was happy to see him there and knew what was coming out of The Sentinel kitchen was going to be brilliant.  To the ultra cool Leary I said "Thank you, Dennis" I think I got back a "yeah" or "your welcome."  I wished I worked in the FiDi to enjoy wonderful food-- I live in the City but work in the Oakland.  For being just a few miles across the water from each other they might as well be on the other side of the planet or better yet a distant planetoid.  Back to The Sentinel it is a great way to experience Leary's cooking frequently and what a treat that is--I always make my way to Canteen; in many ways I wish there were many types of places like Canteen; small, intimate, serious about the food, and a place where a conversation can be had; Canteen and The Sentinel are homages to this food land of San Francisco.

Buen Provecho!
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description:
update:  so before i ordered the special tuna salad today.  i asked if it was a sandwich.  they said yes.  it is on lettuce cups.  not a sandwich my friends.  the small salad is just sliced cabbage - weak.  and my cabbage salad fell all over my almond cake.  almond cake and tuna taste good, but i could've really used a piece of bread or 2.  this was their last chance. :(

i've given this place many chances.  i've had the corned beef, egg salad and a couple of others but nothing is all that great.  i want it to be wonderful, but it's just ok.  and it's a little pricey as well for being just ok.  i wish it was better.  i really really do.....
author: a g.

description: Take it from me, an Irishman, the corned beef sandwich is ridiculously tasty. It's St. Patty's Day everyday. Menu suggestion...a Guinness to go!
author: Michael W.

description: One of the best corned beef "reubens" I've ever had. Definitely not a traditional reuben, and actually for the better, as it wasn't a sloppy mess after a few bites. The roll/biscuit it was served on was unreal (buttery, fresh and warm) while the slaw and russian dressing weren't too heavy. The line looks daunting at first, but its worth the wait...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Probably my favorite lunch spot in the SOMA area. Their bread is to die for and their ingredients are always fresh and constantly changing. Right now my favorite sandwich is the Pork Loin with fig jam and manchego. Breakfast items are also really tasty. Their muffins have a great consistency to them which I almost want to say is a little biscuit like. The wait can be a little long at times because of their popularity and the fact that they are assembling the sandwiches with a little more care than most places. Holly who works behind the counter is super awesome and the rest of the staff are always working hard and super courteous.
author: Alexis G.

description: Went for my first Sentinel lunch order today. My friend got the corned beef sandwich -- fantastic. I understand the raves. I got the daily special, which was a smoked salmon salad. For $11.50, I got a heap of high quality lox on a single piece of butter lettuce with a side of cucumber salad and another odd side of apricot sauce with a half of a sweet role. It wasn't what I expected (had thought I'd get more greens like a traditional salad) and I was a bit disappointed. But the quality was still outstanding and the sandwich was so good that the place still deserves huge props.
author: Shoshana D.

description: I have enjoyed watching this place get better and better with every visit.  I must go there a little too much because they greet me by name.  In fact, I have to force myself to not go there every day I love this place so much.  I am absolutely addicted.  My minor complaint with them prior was their servings were on the small side but that seems to have been adjusted.  They give you a lot of food!  There menu has grown a bit as well so more things to choose from.
author: Piper B.

description: I just have to give special mention to his lunch special today: tuna poached in olive oil on a bed of chickpeas, tomatoes and basil.  A place like this is so rare and precious that any shortcomings expressed by others should be ... well... left to others.  I for one will celebrate and savor the gifts that come out of this little hole in the wall.
author: Curtis Y.

description:
MEATBALLS.

Unbelievably, this was my first experience at The Sentinel.  First off, their business model is amazing.  Small, stripped down and fast.  They must run through six customers per minute.  It's amazing!  Second, their sandwiches are delicious.  I had the lamb meatball sandwich.  The bread was warm and soft on the inside, crispy and seedy on the outside. Top-notch.  The meatballs were seasoned perfectly and basted in a slightly spicy tomato sauce.  Again, simple and delicious.  I'll be back.
author: Alice T.

description: This is perhaps the highest quality lunch for the best price near the Financial District. It's popular, too -- go at a slightly "off" time or be prepared to wait in line. (Apparently you can also call ahead, but I haven't done this so can't vouch for its efficacy.) My biggest gripe is that isn't quite as much food as I'd like, that I don't come out the experience truly full, but this isn't necessarily a bad thing (see: tendency to eat too much). The corned beef sandwich is quite tasty. I didn't enjoy the smoked catfish one so much, though, as it was like a salad made with mayonnaise -- I thought it'd be straight-ahead fish. A lunch special of bockwurst with white beans was delish, and it came with a yummy blondie for dessert. All in all, recommended.
author: Tara M.

description: The best to go lunch in town, period.  Went down today, picked up the Shrimp Salad special for myself, a corned beef reuben for my co worker and everything was stellar.  In and out in 5 min. super good food and good prices for the quality.  If you've missed it, don't delay and get your butt down there!
author: Ron T.

description: You are kidding me right? No really you are kidding me. That was the best pear muffin I have ever had. Ever.
author: Pink G.

description: I've gone here for lunch several times, and there's always a line out the door -- a testament to their sandwiches no doubt! They've got delicious corned beef hash and a fantastic medium rare roast beef (gotta love the horseradish sauce). They get extra points for giving me a cookie when they forgot my sandwich (only about a 2 minute delay)
author: Adam D.

description:
I am in heaven. I knew I would love this place when my colleague would bring back sandwiches from TS.  I had given up corned beef sandwiches because every one I tried in SF wrecked it.  The Sentinel got it right so I returned to my childhood love of corned beef sandwiches: soft, tender, good balance of mild saltiness and sweetness.  I don't even like focaccia flatbreads but this place makes the bread well too.

Wonderful customer service.  The lady there is very cheerful, understanding, & fast.

If only other places who spent more on space, seating, & employees could focus on good food.  This spot is reminiscent of European lunch spots where the food is delicious, excellently made, the meat is perfect, warm service, and fast.

Today was my 1st time and I'm already writing this -- that good!  I'm normally very picky with sandwiches being from NY.
author: S M.

description: I had the corned beef today and it was super tasty. The pickle was gross but that won't stop me from going back.
author: Amy W.

description: so here i am in SF on business & am being put up in a SOMA hotel.  of course i'm hungry; i always am.  thank God for you yelpers...all i had to do was search for "lunch in SOMA" and this lovely little sandwich shop appears.  they were out of chicken salad but the turkey meatloaf i got instead was lovely.  as was the pickle & the lemonade & the chocolate mint.  and the service was super friendly and fast.  see -- if not for you awesome people, my low blood sugar would've driven me to eat at Chipotle or something like that, and i'd have missed out on this gem.  hooray Sentinel!  hooray Yelp!
author: Erika G.

description:
i tried the corned beef sandwich.  It was good - but as a caveat I do not consider myself a sandwich connoisseur.

As my office is a block away, I can see myself coming back.
author: Bigbro T.

description:
This is probably the tiniest kitchen I've ever seen outside a college apartment and yet it successfully services around 50 orders per hour--those cooks are FAST, and the cashier (with her retro register) keeps them plenty busy. I was pleasantly surprised to discover that they have already factored tax into the prices, which makes the line quicker and avoids the annoyance of a pocketful of pennies and nickels. Even though the line stretches a quarter of a block (testament to quality and loyalty), I spent only 10 minutes from the time I got in line to the time I was walking away with my food; now let's face it, you've waited that long at McDonald's on occasion! The food quality at Sentinel is far better (and barely more expensive), though my corned beef Reuben was milder than I generally prefer. Even on today's menu there were 2 other items that sorely tempted me; I'll have to be back to see what they have again soon.

I had been wavering between 4 and 4.5 stars right up until their final, classy touch--each sandwich comes with an Andes mint. Awesome, convenient service; good food; fair price; and a touch of class? I'll definitely be back.

TRIVIA: Andes Chocolate Mints were introduced in 1950 and are produced by Tootsie Roll Industries. I apologize that I was too impatient to lick my way to minty middle layer, but they're just too tasty. :)
author: Bill B.

description:
the Sentinel's corn beef sandwich rocked my world.

their fresh menu of the day tickled my spontaneity.

their vintage cash register made me cha-ching in delight.

and the Dennis Leary sighting satisfied my celebrity chef cravings (when you call, he picks up!).

be one with the Sentinel! eat here for lunch!
author: Diana L.

description: I've been here several times and I always get the corned beef sandwich.  However, this sandwich has gotten worse over time.  It's now smaller and doesn't taste as good as when I first tried it a year and a half ago, which makes it not worth the $8 anymore in my opinion.  I've stopped going here, as there're other great sandwich places around Financial District.
author: Yanina K.

description:
daily specials, seasonal ingredients,watermelon juice, and dennis leary at the sandwich bar - what else can you ask for?  

i'm not a fan of the extra creamy soups (always always creamy) and i wish you had a bit more choice on the bread for your sandwich - it's kind of a roll of the dice if you'll get delicious crispy bread or fluffy white bread roll. also, what's up with all the mayo? on everything? even if you ask for a sandwich without it, it somehow tastes like it still has it. 

the sandwiches are still delicious, but beware, they're messy, so roll up your business casual sleeves and get down and dirty with your beef (or pork, or eggplant, or trout).
author: alina p.

description:
Breakfast:  the morning muffins are incredible - my favorite are strawberry (summer) and squash (fall).  It's quiet-ish over there in the morning, and it can be fun to be there without the mad rush of lunch.  The smell of the fresh baked muffins is enough to make you swoon.  Oh, and their giant brick of coffee cake is dense, delicious, and will fill you up for most of the day.  The coffee is ok, nothing to write home about.  We will sometimes go get muffins then swing through Peet's on the way back to the office.

Lunch: great variety of interesting sandwiches.  I love the focus on fresh, local, seasonal ingredients.  The breads are fresh and yummy.  The semi-new addition of a hot meal is kind of fun.  You never know what the various pieces are going to be!  I recommend picking whatever sounds the most unusual, it can be a surprise.  They had a ground lamb with eggplant and raisins and cinnamon and maybe something else that was A.MAZ.ING.  It sounded weird but all worked super well together.

The experience is why we jokingly refer to him as the Sandwich Nazi in my office.  It's not quite that bad, but it can be sort of funny.  You order, your name is put on a color-coded sticky note and lined up for the chef and line guys.  When it's ready, your name is called.  You really should steup up immediately and take it, or he'll look annoyed.  He'll call your name again - louder, snottier.  If you don't come at that, it goes behind the counter until you come ask for it, at which point you get a withering glance of annoyance.  If you become a regular, loyal customer of the sandwich miracles that he creates, you'll occasionally be rewarded with a free cookie or something.  I recommend this approach, as it sometimes results in them finding another of your favorite sandwich even if they are supposedly out of it.

Go. Eat. Enjoy.
author: Jen G.

description: Ordered a corned beef with gruyere...came with a pickle on the side. The line moved really quickly and food was ready within minutes of paying. I also ordered their orangeade which was a delicious fresh squeeze orange juice. I chose this sandwich over the others because it's on the 7x7 magazine list of 100 things to try before you die. It definitely deserves a spot on this list. Get them while they're hot! After you get your sandwich, walk over to Market and sit on the steps next to Specialty's so you can soak in the sun and people watch. Best corned beef sandwich EVER!
author: Ableen T.

description: After three sandwiches, I'm ready to jump on the Sentinel bandwagon. Today's sandwich, the corned beef on toasted flatbread, was the absolute best.  The sandwich filled the inside of the to-go box. Even better, the bread held up very well to the juicy goodness of the coleslaw and Russian dressing. I washed it down with the lemonade. I've been raving about this place to my co-workers, but they all look at me as if I'm nuts.
author: Eating Sleeping T.

description: A gourmet food stand.  Had the pork shank, avocado soup w/cilantro + jalapeno peppers.  Tasted the cured salmon (not quite lox) sandwich.  I would have liked a bit bolder flavors from the pulled pork shank (most direct comparison is to carnitas which usually has more flavor, but carnitas is rarely not cooked as well nor uses as high quality meat) + thicker avocado soup.  But it's a food stand for god's sake; even with lines you can gourmet food in less than 5 min.    It stands so far above the crowd of fast lunch options in the neighborhood (specialties, lee's deli, chipotle + A.G. Ferrari) that it's silly.  Almost seems like some sort of art installation that'll disappear as fast as it's meteoric rise on Yelp.
author: Kevin G.

description:
good sandwiches, corned beef = the best
breakfast: best coffee cake ever!
fast and easy
great service
holly is super sweet and tries to remember everyone's name
author: Deka M.

description: One comment: This is not a review really, but a caveat. I stepped in this morning around 8AM, and asked about a sandwich, but they don't have sandwiches that early in the morning. I could have pre-ordered one for lunch at the time. Also, has anyone mentioned that they bake their own muffins? There was some sort of strawberry muffin in the oven ready to come out in 5 minutes. I ended up with a warm poppy seed muffin which seems to be the kind that aren't super wet and buttery, but it's good. I'm rating it a four so that my rating won't raise or lower the average star-rating. Oh, one more thing: a couple people, when mentioning this place said "corned beef hash sandwich." There appears to be NO hash. You people are confused. Not all corned beef is served in the hash morphology. You got me all excited, too.
author: Patrick L.

description: BALT sandwich + watermelon juice = summer lunch treat.  Go!
author: Monica M.

description:
4.25 stars.  

My friend waxed poetic about the the sour cherry muffin here.  Unfortunately they didn't have it so we shared the blueberry muffin instead.

It was soooo yummy!! Warm, fluffy, freshly baked, real blueberries, not-too-sweet.  We crammed it down after finishing our breakfast sandwiches from Specialties (which I will yelp soon once my friend tells me which one we went to) while on our way to Napa for a day of wine tasting.  

I will DEFINITELY hit up this place again when I return to SF!! (hopefully soon....)  =)
author: Junkfoodie Q.

description: My co-worker and I had a plan, Friday morning we would finally make it to Sentinel to get coffee and their blueberry muffins. My co-worker (PJ) is running really late and I become extremely stressed/anxious that they will run out of their warm, freshly baked pastries. 10:00 a.m. rolls around and she is still not here, I call Sentinel to ask the status of the muffins and they have only 2 left, I ask to reserve them under my name, expecting a laugh, but they do! We literally sprint over there, pick up the goods and lattes, power-walk back to the office and devour the most ridiculous blueberry muffin ever. It wasn't even warm because we had a long walk back in the cold, so I can't even imagine what it tastes like right out of the oven, guess I will find out tomorrow morning.
author: Laura Gardner S.

description: Fucking quality food.  The BLTA makes you re-appreciate avo, tomato and bread all over again.  The people that work there are so nice and this place makes you feel special and not like you are just getting an every day sandwich.  I am kind of obsessed with checking their website every day to see their special.  Small portions- but that is good because who wants to feel bloated at your desk after work
author: Jessica R.

description: Such a pleasure to have healthy, interesting, delicious AND reasonably priced food from the very talented Mr Leary in the SoMa neighborhood.  The smoked salmon sandwich is excellente!
author: wire c.

description: Incredible--absolutely amazing, ingredient-driven sandwiches and soups, prepared quickly and with friendly service at prices that are downright reasonable for SF.  There are often lines way outside the door, but you can always get out in 10 min or less with a great sandwich.  My personal favorites since it opened have been the chicken salad, the spicy pork w/ peppers, and the roast beef.  I hope it opens a second location closer to where I work, but until then, I'm happy to walk.
author: Ty D.

description: I was really excited for this place. My sandwich was good, but for the price I wasn't impressed. I ordered the BALT, which is probably the cheapest thing on the menu, and it was still an $8 sandwich. In a city where there are tons of great deals, I thought this place was on par with the price, but not a great find. I don't see myself going back.
author: Mike D.

description: asked about the margarine and they promised that there was no margarine in any of their sandwiches ever.  so criticism retracted, now we all know.
author: Stephanie L.

description: For my 200th review, Sentinel seems appropriate.  Delicious, but I'm still hungry and waiting for more.
author: Mitzi C.

description: I've been excited to try The Sentinel ever since I found out Dennis Leary was opening a lunch place right around the corner from my office. I finally got a chance to try it the other day. There was a pretty long line when I got there but it moved quickly. I had the chicken salad sandwich which was really good! Chicken mixed with currants, pine nuts and hot mustard in a soft almost foccacia like roll. Really tasty! I also got their lemonade which was tart and not too sweet and really refreshing on the HOT day.
author: Cathy T.

description: I liked my oatmeal and nonfat latte, both piping hot on a very windy and rainy morning. And I really liked that the spoon I needed to eat my oatmeal was located with other utensils in an old cigar box. A thoughtful touch for what remains one of my favorite downtown discoveries (see previous yelp).
author: Jason B.

description:
Yelping on great eats in SF, I found the great reviews for The Sentinel downtown and decided to try it.  Concerned about the long lines, I went at 11:45a and it took less than a few minutes to have my order in hand.  The staff is extremely friendly and efficient.  I ordered the famous corned beef since other menu items had more inconsistent reviews.  For $8.75 (incl. tax), you get smallish sandwich with focacia-type bread, corned beef, cabbage and homemade russian dressing with gruyere cheese.  

The bottom line:  the focacia bread is too oily, the amount of corned beef is very little by NY deli standards, the flavor of the gruyere over-powered everything else, and the cabbage/russian dressing combo were great.
author: FB N.

description: Yelp, you've redeemed yourself with this place.  Had the corned beef and DW had smoked salmon.  We also shared the potato/leek/porcini soup.  While I have had better corned beef in Montreal and New York, this one was still very good.  Not necessarily for the corned beef, but the pairing of the corned beef with the other flavours was remarkable.  The smoked salmon was also excellent and not too salty.  I would have given the Sentinel 5 stars had the food been not as oily and the soup not as salty.  Otherwise, I'm a fan!
author: Michael L.

description: I really, really like this place. The food is delicious, the service is quick (although not always friendly) but it annoys me to death that these guys use mayo on EVERYTHING even if it has it's own sauce. It's overkill and at least let us know that the egg salad sandwich I just ordered is going to come with a ton of mayo on each side of the bread. It's overkill.
author: Nada D.

description: I don't get the hype.  It's all right, but the food doesn't make me swoon or anything.  I mean I like the limited menu that changes all of the time, but the food (Reuben Sandwich, Salmon something-or-other, etc.) all seem pretty ordinary.  It feels like it should be a solid high-end place (and the staff are great), but the results just aren't there for me.
author: Eric W.

description: best muffins & oatmeal in town! If any of the breakfast specials have sour cherries in them, definitely try them...amazing.
author: danielle r.

description: Corned beef sandwich was fantastic. The beef portion was a little light to meet my protein needs, but for the majority this will be a perfect sandwich.  The mint was a nice touch as well.
author: Cory J.

description: Had a delicious lamb, curry and chickpea sandwich to go, at a good price. Amazing seasoning-- good job guys!
author: Maria G.

description:
Just got the corned beef.
Great sandwich:  nice toasty bread, delicious corned beef.
I'd go back and have it again.
author: Leslie L.

description: WOW! Such a good sandwich! I had 'TUNA NICOISE SANDWICH with green beans, olives, peppers, and chopped egg- 8.75" it was really delicious. I wish there were more green beans but that was about it. The bread was a roll. Nice and soft with different kinds of seeds. There was plenty of tuna nicoise and not too much of the olives or peppers to overpower it. I didn't mind the chopped egg either, I thought oh nice touch. Oh also a very crisp piece of butterlettuce. After going to that horrible Ike's I thought the size was just right! I plan on going back to try the roast beef unfortunately it was sold out! looking forward to going back again.
author: Lisa C.

description: I just love this place! The muffins are heavenly and packed with fruit. The corned beef sandwich is amazing. I've only tried one soup so far-tomato and eggplant-and it rocked. I can't wait to try another one. The cookies are crumbly and delish. The sandwich breads and rolls are freshly-baked. YUM. The counter-girl and chef are super-nice! I've raved about this place to several of my co-workers and they are hooked now...just like me!!!
author: Miya K.

description: Small place on New Montgomery in the financial district that you will miss if you don't pay attention.  I had the corned beef, cabbage, and Swiss sandwich on the recommendation of a colleague and it was great.  The focaccia type bread that the sandwich is served on is worth the trip alone.  It is sprinkled with a light coat of coarse salt that makes all the difference.  I will definitely visit this shop again.   FYI, the place is standing room only, no seating.
author: Chase B.

description: Turkey Meatloaf sandwich was delicious and the butternut squash soup was filling and tasty.  They also have the best muffins in the morning, so delicate, fluffy and warm-their oatmeal is worth every bite too!  This place is AWESOME!!!
author: Steven K.

description: These are some of the best sandwiches ever created. Period. It's that good and all the rave about how delicious and unique their sandwiches is well deserved. However, their portions are quite small (like I have to eat another lunch afterwards), they sometimes run out of items, and it's quite pricey (but it's the Fi-Di, so that's expected). Too bad I don't work in the area, but if I did, I'd come here twice a month guaranteed.
author: Arick R.

description: This place reminded me of a deli I visited in Florence. Very very small, no seating, small menu, but amazing food (the one in florence served wine. If only we could drink wine in the street.) I had the trout sandwich and although my breath might have been a bit nasty afterward, my taste buds were in heaven. High quality ingredients, uncommon toppings like fennel and fig jam, and delicious bread. The menu is very limited, but everything looks great. I wouldn't deem it a great place for vegetarians, yet there's usually at least one item. I haven't tried the soup yet, but a lot of people were ordering soup so it must be good. I can't wait to go back.
author: Alex L.

description: Go just for the Corned Beef and Gruyere sandwich.  Definitely worth the trip, wait and price.  I worked downtown for over a year without knowing about this place.  If you are fortunate enough to work in the FiDi then make the trip.  I would suggest a nice day to do it on so that you can sit outside and enjoy the goodness.  No tables (no inside really) so you can only get to go.  Apparently calling ahead is the way to do it too since it get's crazy during the lunch rush.
author: Brian L.

description: Okay, having now tried the deviled pork loin, the yellowtail ceviche and the salmon sandwiches, I am now convinced that I want a job in FiDi just so I can eat at The Sentinel. All. The. Time.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
usually i deplore sandwiches. boring pieces of filth. two dry pieces of bread with preservative-laden junk stuck in the middle. i'd much rather have a salad or soup- something with *flava*.

but then i came across The Sentinel (yes, caps are deserved, and i say "deserved" with three syllables, so be sure to pronounce it right to get the full vibe). so far, i've only had the luxury of their turkey meatloaf sandwich, which comes with dried cranberries, butter lettuce, a ton of mayo, and some sort of bread which could really pass as a super buttery crispy biscuit. and, of course, the most succulent, tender, juicy, and flavorful flava turkey meatloaf *evah*.

so i figure, if they can take my most-deplored lunch item, pair it with meatloaf, and not only make it *edible* but also *scrumptious*, what the hell can't they do? go! now! for one thing, all the cool people are in line, so it's a chance to network prowl....
author: Cyn K.

description: I'm reserving the 5th star for the corned beef. But the deconstructed chicken salad I had was yummy. Lightly dressed and with pine nuts and I want to say golden raisins. A fennel salad on the side, some brioche and, best of all, fresh strawberries with whipped cream. A delicious meal in a (biodegradable) box. The other items on the menu were the salmon sandwich, a soup of the day and aforementioned corned beef, which looked like the shiz. I've also been a fan of Canteen and Rescue Me (just kidding!) and Sentinel holds true to his form - simple yet tasty.
author: Sig N.

description: The corned beef sandwich rocks.  However, everything else that I have tried was just okay.  If you check the website, the menu constantly changes every day/week.  Hopefully something new will come up that will tempt me to make a trip back.
author: Fotos C.

description: Ok, ok, ok, enough with the glowing reviews. The damn line is getting too long. As I've only eaten the corned beef and the BBQ beef, that's enough for me. Mmm, mmm, mmm. Melt in your mouth. Now they just need to be open all night....
author: J R.

description: Went the first week it opened so it was a bit quite. The small interior is very well done has a bit of old time lunch counter feel. Dennis was in the small open kitchen cooking and chatted with my friend and I. We both had large lattes and a sandwich. I had a salmon sandwich and my friend had a roast pork and Gruyere sandwich. Both were rich and filling. This is a great place to pick something up on a warm day or just to take back to your office. I can't wait to try the pastries!
author: Courtney R.

description: Had lunch here about a month back. Had heard good things but maybe I chose the wrong item? Had the chicken salad. Was not that hot, had a bit of actual fat in it which means it was probably homemade but was also on a plain white roll and just wasn't that special or good. The service was fast though and I've heard other sandwiches there are great so may give another shot one day on a different sandwich.
author: Abby W.

description: $8 for an impressively delicious sandwich.  Features: a pickle and an Andes mint.  This place is great.  Sure beats a $12 salad.  Yeah, I'm looking at you, Mixt Greens!
author: Kasima T.

description: Best espresso in SOMA. Warm-from-the-oven muffins and coffee cake. And everybody knows about the sandwiches.
author: Brandon R.

description: The Sentinel is one of those places that you just have to go to at least once. The reason why is that you'll pretty much have to go back again after that first visit. A friend of mine from work recommended this place to me and I was immediately a fan. With it's rotating menu of savory and delicious dishes it makes for a unique and special lunch spot to break you out of that mundane rotation of your usual everyday work-week lunch spots. I highly recommend the Braised Pork Shoulder, the Tres Leches cake, The Corned Beef on Flatbread, and best of all the Toffee Chip cookie. Unbelievably I have not stopped in for any breakfast items, but I know their pastries and oatmeal have a big following in our office. On top of all of this, they are fast, efficient, and extremely friendly.
author: Thomas K.

description: This is a great sandwich place downtown! Don't expect great variety or cheap prices but the quality is superb.  I went here with some co-workers and was almost scared off by the line winding outside but it moved very quickly.  This place is super efficient! They post their menu and daily special on their website so if you are picky or just excited about food I'd recommend scoping the menu ahead of time.  The sandwiches here are unusual and tasty! I had the Corned Beef with Gruyere.  It was soooo good! The sandwich was hot and fresh plus they give you a pickle too! Of course this is more expensive than a meatier sandwich at Lefty O'Doul's but I think the ingredients are higher quality.  I liked it and plan to go back again soon!
author: Laura B.

description: I went back last week and the awesome cashier is no longer there. :( Sandwiches are still great though.
author: Johnnie M.

description: This place is fantastic.  Had the Turkey Meatball with Blue Cheese.  Delicious.
author: David C.

description: Really lived up to the hype for me.  I had the corned beef sandwich and thought it was fantastic!  Can't wait to go back tomorrow and try another one.
author: Christin A.

description: These guys do an AMAZING job!!  I have never written a Yelp review before, but I felt extremely compelled to share.  We ordered around 30 sandwiches for an office lunch and within a 1/2 hour, they had all completed and ready to go.  Not to mention, we ordered during the lunch rush.  Great service and fantastic sandos!!!
author: Jordan D.

description: I come for lunch regularly. This is my favorite lunch place. The corned beef is always a safe bet, but I like being adventurous and trying the specials too. I feel sad for the people waiting to get Subway sandwiches at the other end of the alley.
author: Nathan M.

description: 75% of the sandwiches were sold out but I did get there around 2pm on a Friday so maybe that was partly my fault.  I ended up having the spicy pork sandwich.  The bread was soft and slightly sweet.  The pork was good.  It wasn't really spicy.  The pork juice or sauce or combination of the two kept dripping out so I would rip a piece of my bread off and absorb back the juice.  Maybe I would go back one day to try the corned beef sandwich.
author: Jo W.

description:
possible the best sandwich i have ever had by far the best corned beef sandwich.

after reading some of the good reviews i had wanted to stop in here and i am sooo happy i did!

after one bite (and this may seem like i am exaggerating - but its true!) my knees started to wobble. 

im not even a fan of corned beef!

looking fwd to getting this every time i am in SF - absolutely loved it!
author: dave r.

description: My office recently moved from Embarcadero to Montgomery and I noticed that this place always has a line.  So I tried it today, I got the roast beef.  The roast beef was nice and rare, just the way I like it, the bread was good.  It would have been a great sandwich, but it was ruined by the absurd amount of some mayonnaise concoction (which I've since learned they call russian dressing) that was literally dripping off the sandwich.  Berk!  They need to use a good horseradish or dijon to go with roast beef.  After reading a few reviews it sounds like they slather this sandwich ruining element they call russian dressing on all their sandwiches.  They'll never make a good sandwich as long as they're all slathered with that crap.
author: D C.

description: Very good! I had the corned beef sandwich, which was excellent, and a chocolate chip cookie. The cookie was decent, but it's definitely not going up on my top cookies list.
author: Monika M.

description:
mmmm.... The strawberry muffin that came straight out of the oven smelled so good this morning that I was tempted to keep it in the bag and inhale the scent all day. But then I wouldn't be able to eat it, so that wasn't a good idea!

The guy behind me ordered the oatmeal coffee cake. Next time I'll try that.
author: Julie M.

description:
yet another item knocked off the 7x7 list for me - the corned beef sandwich with gruyere from the sentinel.

and this one belongs! been here twice now. the only reason i don't come more often is that it's just a little too long of a walk. otherwise, it'd probably be on my regular list. this is a special occasions place for me. :) 

both times i ordered the corned beef, and each time tasted equally delicious. they griddle the sandwich, so the focaccia crisps and the cheese is melty. mmmmmmm. the corned beef is lean, but it's not healthy, and the russian dressing is the perfect amount of tangy. each sandwich comes with half a small pickle and an andes mint. 

the second time i came, i had done a phone in order for a team lunch of 10 people. admittedly, it was a little crazy of a process, cause i called in the day before to ask how early i would have to call my order in to get it on time, and she told me to email. in the email, i asked for a confirmation, and since i didn't get one by 10:45 the next day, i decided i'd call in to make sure. thank goodness i did b/c they said that email wasn't the best way to order. :/ plus, the order wasn't ready when i wanted it to be, and i had even arrived 15 minutes later... but i'm not knocking them for that... we also ordered the dessert of the day - sour cherry cake. fluffy cake topped with powdered sugar and cherries inside (not sour as advertised, but that's totally ok). yum. they ended up giving me a sandwich for free + 2 extra desserts. if you're calling in a big order and you're the one picking up, see if they'll give you a sandwich discount - they have a policy which allows delivery order couriers to receive their lunch for free. say you're the courier and maybe a free sandwich awaits your future. :) 

i love you sentinel. (however, miller's east coast deli is still my favorite place for brined meats)
author: Melissa C.

description: This is a painful addition to my work neighborhood.... Looks like I shall be spending $10 to $15 for lunch from now on.... Previous lunches used to cost $3 or $5 but now that The Sentinel came to the area, there isn't much I can do. I mean I can't just walk past it and consciously choose to go somewhere else.
author: Janel A.

description:
Easily overlooked as this is a tiny little deli in the corner with no seating.  I heard about this from another friend who said this place was da bomb, so I thought I'd give it a try because I was meeting 2 other friends in the city for lunch on a Friday.  I never thought I'd have free time to go to the city on a weekday, but luckily i had a day off :)

And so, I heard this place had crazy lines, but we didn't get there until close to 2pm and there weren't many people there.  But shortly after we walked into the deli, they closed the door behind us.  The menu didn't have a lot of choices, but it seemed like it changes frequently and it may be better to go earlier because they'd run out of ingredients to make some of the sandwiches.  I ordered a spicy turkey sandwich on ciabatta bread.  The ciabatta bread was of high caliber and probably one of the freshest if not the freshest ciabatta bread that I've ever eaten.  The meat of the meal consisted of cubed slices of peppered turkey, mustard, and shredded lettuce if I remember correctly.  I thoroughly enjoyed it half way through before the mustard started to get to me, but it was definitely filling and it was packed so much that everything was just falling out like a sloppy joe.  If you like deli sandwiches, then you should stop by here, but be wary that there could be frustratingly long lines unless you go near closing time.
author: David Y.

description: I don't understand.  I'm not quite sure what the rave is about. I tried the "famous" corned beef sandwich and did not think it was amazing at all.  When I eat it, it wasn't anything amazing...it's like eating any ordinary sandwich.
author: Sim T.

description: I got there around 1pm and that was too late as I now understand. The bread was the run-of-the mill sandwich loaf with some flare. It wasn't toasted or anything so it just was meh. I will try this place a second time, but earlier, to see how it turns out.
author: Benjamin T.

description: darn good sammiches... a bit pricey ($1.75 for a can of orangina, really?) but worth checkin' out...
author: Ricky S.

description:
OMFG!  To die for sandwiches...  I've only tried the turkey meatloaf, egg salad and corned beef so far, but will be trying out more stuff in near future.  All of the sandwiches are num yummy, deceptively small, fresh as can be, and num yummy satisfying.  The corned beef has the effect of putting people in a food coma about 15 minutes after eating it.  The chef who owns this store really knows a thing or two about QUALITY.  Quite a refreshing change from all the slop that's in the Financial District.  (And people wonder why I bring my lunch from home all the time...)

Try it, you'll like it.
author: J H.

description: Just a kind reminder to people who don't like this place, do not come back! I'll personally thank you. Let's keep that line moving.
author: Joon L.

description: tasty sandwiches, but kinda small for the price and amount of time spent in line.
author: Greg H.

description: The pomegranate/lemon drink and half of the pork sandwich makes a really filling lunch.  I'll have to go back to try more!
author: James D.

description: Gourmet lunch to go. Oddly upscale to go in a city where we tend to be more luxurious about well-prepared meals, yet seductively cheap. Damn it's good.
author: Adam L.

description: Mmmmmm... That was one tasty corned beef sammich. With gruyere and cabbage/slaw. Despite some other reviewers being disappointed with the portion size, I was quite full after that hefty hot beef injection. Although the bottom slice of rye did get a bit waterlogged from the cabbage, and it turned into a bit of a mess towards the end, it was still a damn fine sammy. I'll definitely be back for more.
author: Brian J.

description: Snaking loooong line over lunch. TIP-GET THERE BY 1130am so that u can lay ur hands on the yummy sandwich. Tried the corn beef brisket today and I love the pickled cabbage in the sandwich...perfect! And the cold tomato soup....wow refreshing on a hot summer day. It was simple but delish. Will have a perfect 5 stars if there were seats but anyways it is all take out and u can stroll to the Yerba Buena Gardens for a nice lunch in the park :)
author: Topazskye L.

description: There's always a line, but always worth the long wait.  My favorite is the rare roast beef sammie with horseradish cream cheese spread.
author: M. B.

description: Yum yum! Tis place is awesome. I went there for lunch one afternoon, and loved it. 1st I loved the quaintness of this place..its just a corner sandwich shop in the financial district--nothing pretentious. The menu is small and limited which I believe to be a good thing. Rather than offer a million mediocre items, it serves just a few delicious selections. I had the Corned beef sandwich with Gruyere and it was FAN-TAS-TIC! I actually am not really a corned beef person, but this was so mouth wateringly good. It was a good portion size so you don't feel sick after eating it, but it was filling and melts in your mouth. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the place was very clean. I consider this place a must for a lunch-time fix.
author: S A.

description: This is one of my default places to get lunch in this area because it's consistently good. I even like that the menu is short, but ever changing. They have interesting and tasty sandwiches, which keeps me from getting tired of this place.
author: Heewa B.

description: Yum Sandwich.  They may look small, but they are substantial and really stays with you.  After finishing my entire meal, along with a roasted peach over berad pudding, I was stuffed and doomed to spend the rest of the day in a food coma.
author: Legal D.

description:
I really don't understand the hype. Sorry. I thought I would like it and really wanted to... BUT, I have tried this place twice and thought it was only ok....nothing too special. The smoked salmon sandwich was tasty, but I had better. I also tried the corned beef sandwich. I thought the bread was WAY too greasy..... I did not want to touch it. It was tasty though. 

I wanted to order the ham and cheese, but did not want the mustard. THE CHEF refused to leave the mustard out!!! HE SAID it was good with the mustard so the mustard has to stay. Well, I don't like mustard. I did not appreciate his attitude.
author: vernice l.

description: Get there early folks as they run out. I always try to get the pork, but if they sell out, the corned beef is a good stand by.
author: Lisa L.

description: This walk up sandwich service doesn't have seating, but that doesn't matter.  The corn beef sandwich is on the list of top 100 things to eat in San Francisco for a reason; it's delicious.  Sandwich comes with a pickle and an mint.  Recommendation: Walk up a block to the Muni/Bart stop area and enjoy nomming (eating) this tasty twist on a reuben in the sun while people watching.
author: Jessica T.

description: Food is great at Sentinel but the counter gals are mean to the women.  I have seen them be "icky" sweet to the guys but when a lady places an order.....cold cold cold attitude.  Owners of Sentinel, please ask your female staff to be nicer to the ladies. We are paying customers too.
author: Z W.

description:
This place has and forever will change lunch for me. Calling ahead, emitting a heavy sigh when they run out of whatever it is that I wanted most that day, and never, ever saying hold the mayo are things that I never though would happen in between meetings as I run out for a quick bite.

These guys know how to make great sandwiches. I love the pickles and mints that come with each. They also know my name and have complimented my smile on occasion.

My favorite is the chicken salad or corned beef.
author: Kaveh A.

description: the word for this place is "quality". just awesome. but you should get there early if you want to have you pick of the menu... they run out of stuff pretty darn fast.
author: Ashley A.

description: Solid.  A wee bit small... but yummy.... Not sure if its the best veggie the bbq eggplant was a little drenched in BBQ, but the juxtapoz with the goat cheese did really pull the room together...  I will have to return when I am feeling more carniverous...
author: Yosh K.

description: The absolute best coffee cake (still warm and gooey as it's slid into the little white to-go bag) and amazingly spiced chai, ever...
author: Bee H.

description:
As I was walking back to work, i needed a quick bite to eat.  I thought of getting a Flames burger, but as I approached The Sentinel, I saw a turkey sandwich on the menu that I wanted to try.  I had enjoyed the braised pork shoulder, cabbage salad with a side of fresh strawberries the prior week.  When I went to the counter to order, the pleasant  young lady  said they were out of the turkey sandwich, but they did have a hot corn beef sandwich which wasn't on the menu.  The corn beef sandwich comes in a hard ciabatta roll thinly sliced corn beef with shredded cabbage with a light dijon mustard and aged gruyere cheese.  It's absolutely a quality sandwich.  It also came with a light dressed cucumber salad with feta cheese.   I would have to say it's one of the best corn beef sandwich I ever had.  Traditionalist will probably like rye bread, but the crisp ciabatta roll was the key for me.  I know food sells out fast here, but I got lucky  when the turkey sandwich sold out at 1:30p. 

It's a little more what I usually spend for lunch, but it's well worth the quality and freshness.  I just have to venture over to try Canteen now.
author: Calvin H.

description: Since I didn't bring leftovers for lunch today I had to come back here, and I wasn't disappointed.  But I just had to write that I tried their watermelon juice and it was phenom.  It was perfect for a warm day like today!  Plus no line!
author: Lorraine Y.

description:
I ordered the best reuben sandwich today!  Yum!!

The prices are good too.

Go early or late, otherwise you have to wait in line.

I can't wait for my next lunch at the Sentinel!
author: Pam W.

description: So good, I'll be coming here once a week. The lady behind the counter is super-friendly and the food is light and flavorful. Nothing makes the workday go by easier than a ridiculously gourmet salmon sandwich and a rich tomato bisque soup. Almost makes you forget you're wasting your life away. Sigh.
author: Emily F.

description: The food is great, the service is friendly (and fast), and (surprisingly, I mean it's a sandwich place right?) the coffee is awesome.  (I'm a plain old drip coffee guy, and still miss being able to order a Regular Coffee in New York and get it like I want: with milk and sugar.)
author: Tom H.

description: Superb, every time.  Pleasant staff along with a varying array of freshly baked breakfast foods and delicious soups and sandwiches for lunch. I go there as often as I can.
author: vinay d.

description: I should rate as one star to shorten the line. However, the Sentinel is easily the best walk-up counter in downtown San Francisco. In tracking down recipes for Russian dressing in a few dozen cooksbooks ('past its time,' according to some), I only came across it in the Joy of Cooking. Thank you DL.
author: Brett V.

description: Uniquely good sandwiches, great soup, interesting drinks.  Buy a sandwich and go to Yerba Buena Gardens to eat it.
author: Stephen L.

description: Came here for sandwiches the other day and was pretty pleased.  They had a lot of delicious looking things on the menu including a coppa sandwich with pumpkinseed pesto, a pulled pork sandwich (they serve it cold, personally I think ALL pulled pork sandwiches need to be hot!), and lamb & feta meatballs with spicy tomato sauce.  I ended up getting the lamb one and while the meatballs were quite tasty, they were rather big and unwieldy, making the sandwich difficult to eat and impossible to pick up.  My advice - bring a knife or ask them to cut it for you.  My boyfriend got their special of the day which was a salmon salad with butter lettuce, red onion & cucumber w/ a side of chocolate flan and a piece of bread.  The salmon was really good, not just the boring strip of salmon you usually get.  The flan was more custard-y than flan-y but good, esp. if you like chocolate.  I don't think I'd get the lamb meatball sandwich again but that's just because I want to try all the other sandwiches.  I've been told their menu changes frequently which is exciting to me as it seems to be seasonal.  Also - this place has a long line and no places to sit so keep that in mind.  Next time I want to order one of their strawberry lemonades which comes with real chunks of strawberry in it.
author: Suzanne V.

description:
It was LOVE at first bite with Sentinel's Corned Beef Sandwhich. A sandwhich that will play the last half of Beethoven's 9th symphony in my mouth is something to be written about.   It's not Katz's NYC, but it's a pretty fricken good sandwhich and fills the void ...you know, because there's a lack of real good deli's in the Bay Area.

The second time I went there I got the salmon sandwhich - very interesting and creative indeed, but not as earth shattering as the corned beef....er, it wasn't a sentinel event. 

My co-worker went whoppers for the Ham sandwhich, but not as impressed w/ the pork.

Besides the food part, I love the simplicity - short menu allows me to not spend too much time debating over what I'll get and quick in'n out way of getting your food.  

Last tip is order ahead of time!
author: Sharon W.

description: AMAZING best sandwich I gave ever had, took my parents (who are major Dennis Leary fans) when they were in town we grabbed lunch and went and ate at the yerba buena gardens by the fountains, they loved thier respective meals too.......soooo delish the foccacia is amazing and I had the tuna sandwich with fennel and chopped egg which i dont even normally like and it was out of this world good. The sndwich looked small but it was  satisfying with rich flavor mmmmm want one now! Also try the lomonade yum!
author: Madeline S.

description:
Delicious.  Amazing.  Second visit in two days. 

The menu changes regularly, but in case you catch this one, the Spicy Chicken Salad Sandwich is amazing!  Zippy chicken with occasional raisin or pistachio, on soft roll.  Pickle on the side.  I agree that a full sandwich is  much more than I can eat -- splitting with a friend was ideal.  

No lines if you go early.
author: Sadie S.

description:
Like another yelper said -- I agree and think this place is a hit or miss -- and it was a miss for me. 
I came here because a coworker of mine was looking into trying a new spot for lunch and she yelped and found Sentinel with good ratings and hype. 
So it was the three of us..we all got different items and the review from all three of us -- It was OKAY .... i guess we expected more considering how many 4+ stars it got. 
Most likely won't go here again...
author: Julie M.

description: I've staked out every decent sandwich place downtown, and Sentinel is far and away the best. Ingredients are top notch, very flavorful, and unique menu.  A little pricey but you get what you pay for
author: Dave G.

description:
A few months ago, I was going to Yelp about this place with the coveted 5 stars.  It is a great little sandwich place (no seating... it is as close to a "hole in the wall" as you can get).  I've had the Coppa salami (excellent) and the Ratatoulle (very good!).
Yesterday, I had the egg salad.  Although it was a good egg salad sandwich, it was definitely not up to my expectation from this high-end sandwich dispensary.  It was... well... just a plain old egg salad sandwich... which would be ok if it weren't an $8.25 egg salad sandwich.
The people at the counter are always friendly and efficient.
UPDATE:
Ok, no more egg salad sandwiches for me... but I decided to try the Tofu sandwich.  Wow, it was fantastic!  I have seen the Tofu sandwich on the menu but never ordered it... because how good can a tofu sandwich be.  Theirs is great.  It has just enough chili sauce to give it some zing and the peanuts are a nice touch. I liked it so much that I ordered it again the following day.
author: Kevin T.

description: yipidee doo da. finally got to try a sandwich from here.  overrated i think not.  sure there menu is not huge, but i think that is kinda cool.  I will be back for the next 3 days and next time ill buy 2 sandwiches, because im a glutton.
author: christopher h.

description: I'm not really a five star givin' guy, but the smoked trout sandwich is freaking awesome.  Yes, Mr. Leary was a little short with me when I couldn't make up my mind, but when I got back to my car and took a bite, I couldn't stop.  Sitting in my car on Mission St, devouring the lovely goodness without a second thought to how I must have looked, rolling my eyes at the pure brilliance of this sandwich, having watched one of the top chefs in The City prepare it before my eyes...well, you get the mayonnaise and butter foccatia crumbs covered picture.  If you don't get this place, then don't bother going to Canteen for dinner, cuz yr just going to be taking up my seat.  Dennis Rocks.
author: Mr. Fist o.

description: hungry and specifically on a mission to get my hands on the corned beef sandwich, i packed up a baby bulldog in my backpack (i was puppy sitting) and parked near the ferry building. Appa the dog and i walked up Market stopping every ten feet or so so that people could pet him. what should have been a five minute walk took more like half an hour. plus that sucker ended up being heavy. practically starving, i couldn't wait to inhale the sandwich. and inhale is exactly what i did, except i did it cause i was hungry and not cause it was a great sandwich. it was "aiight." i can't really say i liked it. it was just okay to me. i think i didn't like the bread choice and i also didn't want whatever orangish hot saucy thing they had in there. it was slightly spicy to me. maybe they put the wrong sauce in mine??  to make matters worse, on our walk back to the car the cute little puppy peed in my backpack. fun. not!
author: Regina C.

description: I've been back several times now and absolutely everything is delicious!  I had the turkey pastrami today for the first time and it was yummy, really substantial and a great deal at $8.  Coudn't resist the chocolate chip cookie either.  And everyone who works there is very friendly, especially the young woman who takes orders.  I am amazed that she actually remembers my rather difficult to pronounce first name each time I visit.  Chef Leary is really doing a wonderful thing by bringing his caliber of cooking at reasonable prices to the masses, so to speak.
author: mun p.

description:
ok, first off, i will go back and give it another shot... but for this visit i could barely give this place 2 stars.
i have continually walked by and passed on this place because of a huge line out the door,  figured today was a good day to try it since the line was minimal. and since one of my co-workers swore by this place, decided i couldn't go wrong... first mistake...
being that it is the week of thanksgiving, decided to go with the vegetarian option, the bbq'd eggplant.... yuck, and double yuck! when i read, bbq'd, i figured the eggplant would be bbq'd, not smothered, and i mean drenched in bbq sauce. the sauce overpowered the whole sandwich... goat cheese, basil ??? why bother? why bother putting anything on the sandwich other than that sauce.
needless to say, it was not a very satisfying lunch, however i will give them another try and hopefully will have a better experience
author: connie a.

description: Short menu, but small space so OK.  The quality of the ingredients is tops.  Warm pastrami sandwich among the best I've had, but the cake dessert option I chose fell a little short.  Great destination for take away lunch in this neighborhood though!
author: Greg P.

description: This is a tough one.  The first time I had tried Sentinel, I was impressed.  The sandwich was actually the best I have had.  During my second visit, i had found myself on the other end of the spectrum.  I think Sentinel can be considered bold, and sometimes overly so.
author: David G.

description: close to work and always tasty!  a bit on the pricey side but worth it for the quality!
author: Sue B.

description: One of the best lunches near Market St.  Fantastic sandwiches, fast service.
author: Joshua A.

description:
delicious. right price. great quality and frequent menu changes.

seems like some items have gotten a little lighter recently (the small oatmeal to the point i won't get it, the corned beef but it's still really satisfying)

oh also, the ordering/ticket system they have should be legendary. different color post-its for each sandwich, in a little stack with your name on the top one. before they instituted this system, the line was a nightmare. as soon as they started doing it (and maybe they added some personnel too, maybe) the line started flying. totally impressive no text system.
author: Wangston P.

description: I absolutely love this place. So far I've tried the asparagus, mushroom and smoked gouda sandwich and the fresh salmon sandwich (w/o the smoked salmon layer b/c I'm pregnant)... and I think I'll be back there tomorrow third time in a row. The food is not too pricey either - the $8 dollar sandwiches come in a generous size. I work on 2nd and Mission, and this has to be my favorite lunch spot... at least for now.
author: Iskra G.

description: great meatball sandwich, but they have a 10 min for credit-card purchase, which is crap.
author: Fady A.

description: The best quick lunch I've had yet in the city. They take plastic, which is key. There was a bit of a line when I got there at 12:30, but not even 5 minutes went by before I had ordered and received a delicious grilled panini with both baked and smoked salmon. When I got down to eating, I then realized that my sandwich had come with an individually wrapped pickle (and a very solid kosher dill, at that) and an Andes mint! Totally worth the 8 bucks. This is now my go-to lunch spot in the FiDi. Well done, Sentinel.
author: Justin N.

description: not worth the line, they were out of juice, and the much-hyped corned beef was super soaked in oil. it was like eating a handful of kimchee.
author: Hayden S.

description: came here for lunch today thinking its st. paddy day and in the american spirit of st. patricks day, i should have some kind of corned beef and cabbage. and thats what led me to the sentinel. when i first approached the sentinel it only seemed like there were a few people in line. that is until i looked around the corner. there were like 20 people in line at noon. should have called in advance. is it always like this at noon, or was it just today. whatever the case, i got the corned beef and cabbage sandwich. it was pretty good. almost finished all of it. i have to mention though, the slice of pickle that i got was eh. so mediocre, i'm a huge fan of pickles and the one i got was eh - no crunch, and all soggy. minus 1 star.
author: Heather S.

description: I'm debating about this one... The salmon sandwich was very good, but $9 is quite pricy for a relatively small sandwich from a take out place.
author: E H.

description: I went there in the first weeks they were open and honestly I don't get this place at all, or the rabid reviews.  Although we got there earlyish, they were out of ingredients for half the only four items on their menu. The cashier was utterly clueless and did not handle the sold out issue well at all. Anyway, I guess I will give it another shot based on the more recent reviews but I had a middline roast beef sandwich with literally nothing on it but a smear of horseradish cream cheese. Huh? For $9? The soup was indeed very good and the coffee was killer, but seems like they could do better if their MO is to hone down to a couple of amazing things and that is all however. The lines are mega-long every day so go early or late (and risk them being sold out of a lot of stuff too).  I'll give it one more shot based on the rapturous reviews and the fact that it is one block from my office, but I would not hike across town to go here...
author: Kirsten M.

description: awesome sandwiches that kick ass - the bbq vegetarian sandwich i had today was incredible. mega yum!!!!!! makes me miss canteen, gotta have another dose of that soon.
author: Domenique B.

description: lunch with chef ... his food taught me how to be patient and let the flavors unfold, when i wanted to utter somehting wrong with the seasonings or adjust the food, i told myself, "wait, be patient, the chef knows what he's doing, don't be american - now! now! now!"  we like extended foodplay;  just terrific and visit his test kitchen restaurant,  canteen when you want to sit down for food sex!
author: tim y.

description: I love the service & food here. Sandwich prices are your typical downtown prices but you will get good quality food. Everyone is super nice despite the crazy long lines. I had their muffins in the morning as well and it really shows that they make them fresh every morning unlike the nasty pastries @ Starbucks. I think most of their staff is at the Sentinel now (hence the bad service @ Canteen).
author: Xuyen H.

description: I love this place. Come early if you don't want to wait in line. It s ALL good, but the hot, corned beef, on focaccia with french dressing it the best sandwich I'll ever have. I also love, love their daily special plate which always makes my day b/c on top of being delicious it comes with a small dessert. They post their daily menu on line, so somedays my choice of going or not is based on what the special without me leaving my desk, 'cause it is 4 blocks from my office.
author: Caitlin S.

description: The most incredible sandwiches...damn, I wish The Sentinel was in Pac Heights...
author: Tonya M.

description: i keep thinking about the corned beef sandwich i ate.  so delicious.
author: Stephanie Z.

description: I ordered the Swedish meatball sandwich and the meatballs were raw inside.
author: Mary O.

description: will you people stop reviewing this place. hello? it's a tiny secret gem and you guys are totally ruining the lines for this place. go away. go away. if they run out of that trout sandwich I'm gonna kick someone's azzz....
author: L. M.

description: Best muffins and sandwiches EVER! Highly recommend this place, although the lunch line is a bummer!
author: Britta S.

description: jumped on the bandwagon the minute the daily candy posting came out. the cold soups are REALLY good. like too good. i'm happy to see more veg options (the other day was basil, avocado, tomato, lettuce)
author: Anita C.

description: been here a few times. the line can get a bit long, but they're pretty efficient and it goes by fast. only thing i've ever had is the BALT with havarti. wouldn't say it's worth 8.25, but i keep coming back for it so that's gotta say something. fresh ingredients, fast service, and an overall solid sandwich. and i may or may not have gotten food poisoning once (not like that stopped me anyway).
author: Lia A.

description:
i've been here twice and have been blown away both times. the pork loin sandwich was off the the chain. very rich and tender. 

today i had the yellow tail- avocado and fennel sandwich and it was smack your mamma good. all the flavors blended so well, with none of them overpowering the super fresh fish. it was superb. 

and props to whoever is responsible for making the breads. the sentinel has some of the best sandwich bread i've ever laid lip to.
author: Webbster G.

description: Don't Bother. $8.00 for an Avocado sand which. The Avocado was tiny and not ripe and the goat cheese was about the size of a quarter. Talk about a ripoff. They corner your $ with one veggie option that stinks.
author: CJ K.

description: YUM i got their corned beef sandwich. This was my first time trying out this place. The lines sure do move fast I got there before the lunch rush started they made my sandwich literally in 2 seconds and they gave me a whether's orginal candy. Great service! I'll have to make another visit and try out their other sandwiches
author: Crum B.

description: Simply the best sandwiches in San Francisco.   The bread is baked on premises, the ingredients are unique, fresh and gourmet.  I mean where else can you find a sandwich with both poached salmon and smoked salmon with avocado?  Delicious and friendly service.   That's why there is always a line.
author: Eric P.

description: omg.  thank you, yelp!  just finished demolishing a shrimp salad sandwich with fennel, cucumber, and peas -- ridiculously fresh and light and really unlike anything i've ever had before.  only downside was that since i called ahead, it was somewhat soggy by the time i got it -- but since calling ahead means you can literally walk right up the register, pay, grab your food and go, i'd say it was worth it.  at $9 a sandwich it's a splurge, but oh-so-worth-it!
author: niki c.

description: Good sandwiches.  Menu changes often.  Only open during lunch hours.  Seem to focus on small subset of lunch audience.  Great if it fits you.  Go for good food.  The line says it all.  If you have to wait it is probably worth waiting for, although the line moves quick quickly.  I seems like they every going well.
author: Brian S.

description:
yeaaah... i'm sure guys would love the roast beef sandwich.  it was just way too meaty for me.  i felt like there wasn't very much flavor on it too.

my friend ordered the yellow tail sandwich and they forgot to put the avocado on it so maybe that altered the taste but it was way too citrusy for us.  

didn't feel worth the money or the long wait...
author: S T.

description: Got the Corned Beef sandwich and it was delicious. I was expecting it to be really salty but I was completely surprised. The cabbage helped to round out the corned beef flavor. (I mean what's corned beef without the cabbage!) There were a fair amount of people in line but I was able to order and receive my sandwich within 10 minutes. Will definitely try again!
author: Mei F.

description: If you've been fortunate enough to experience Canteen, then you'll know just how INSANE The Sentinel is. I work down in Cupertino, but I worked from home today just so that I could experience The Sentinel. I had the B.A.L.T. (basil, avocado, lettuce, tomato) and my wife had the Rueben. The fresh baked bread of the B.A.L.T. was excellent as it had a tinge of buttery goodness and it was seriously... I don't know... It was... Uhm... I don't have words to describe. The lettuce was NOT iceberg, but like a butter lettuce, the basil was fresh and the avocado was perfect. Oh yeah, and whatever the mayo mixture that was on the sandwich, was really tasty. My wife's Rueben had a perfect mixture of Russian dressing, meat and a grilled bread that was out of this world. The Orange Ade was fantastic -- it tasted like a gourmet Orange Julius -- and the chocolate hazelnut cookie was melt in your mouth good. I'm gonna have to start working from home more often.
author: Chris G.

description: The way work lunch should be done...only wish they let you order ahead online...
author: treven c.

description: Our office was super excited to see this place open up.  We could use some new "good" food in the hood.  The coffee and coffee drinks are good and they beat Starbucks any day;  but, $2 for a drip coffee is a bit much, they need to get more in the priceline of the neighborhood.  The food is good but not $11 roast beef sandwich good, then it is only considered decent for the price.  If I spend $8+ for a sandwich I want it to blow me away and to linger on my tastebuds for hours - it does not.  The same goes for an $11 salad, good but small and not worth $11.  I hope they lower their prices and stick around - the small menu concept is nice but not the over priced prices.  Aren't we in a recession?
author: DL W.

description: 15 minute wait to order  //  5 minute wait for food // Reuben was no Max's Reuben, but serviceable nonetheless.  the watermelon juice, the cookie, and the counter help were all 5-star yelp worthy.  what a day, though... sentinel for lunch and dynamo donuts for an afternoon snack.  I don't care who gets elected as long as there are eating days like these.
author: david b.

description: This is a take away that mainly serves the business lunch crowd from Market St area. Although the menu appears to be a simple take away soup and sandwich shop you will be blown away at your first bite. The food is exquisitely prepared using very creative flavor combinations that one would normally find in an expensive gourmet restaurant. A very good value at a reasonable price.
author: volspill

description: alright, i admit to being a sucker for any celebuchef business. so when i heard that dennis leary of sf's canteen was running this little lunch shack i happily waited on the long line to get the goods. i had a roast beef salad with lemon, thyme and potatoes. it was 11 bucks. it was.....not at all what i was expecting. the roast beef was tender but cold (well, it was a salad after all i guess) and looked a little gray and naked tossed with the sorta undercooked potatoes. the thyme and lemon did add a nice somethin' somethin'. my favorite part of this very tiny lunch was the side of some sort of slaw. very tangy and flavorful indeed. and in its own tiny compartment, a little blob of sludgy dark chocolate. i suppose it was intended as a dessert pudding of sorts, but it seemed more like a decadent frosting. however, my friend got a corned beef sandwich for 8 bucks and repeatedly exclaimed happily about it while munching away. id go back but im still bummed about paying 11 bucks for a small portion of cold chunks of gray meat. bah.
author: Amy S.

description: thinking about the corned beef sandwich makes me drool - everytime.  i've had the BALT, the specials (seafood, pork shoulder, peach cobbler, strawberry rhurbarb pie, choc mousse) and they are all fantastic!  the ingredients taste so fresh (even the lemonade!).  the wait can be off-putting when you are rushing for lunch but i love, love, love (love x 100) this place! ;)
author: tc h.

description: do yourself a favour and go some morning on your way to the office and buy a blueberry muffin. i've not eaten there for a while and still i fantasize about that crumbly, warm, blueberry tastyness. i'm sure all the food is yummy too (such as the A.L.T. sandwich that i've been eyeing) but really, that blueberry muffin was just mouthwatering. welcome to the neighborhood Sentinel!
author: Bridget L.

description: i had the corned beef sandwich that everyone is talking about. it was good. not great; just good. i could have made it better at home though. i have to say, ike's is still the best sandwich in the city.
author: Ben H.

description: Ok - I knew I had to wait a few weeks for this place to hit their stride...and they did.  I decided to treat myself for lunch yesterday and got their BALT (basil, avocado, lettuce and tomato) and the chilled cucumber soup.  The sandwich was delicious...and I loved how like 2 people when I ordered it made sure I knew there was "no bacon in it...it's vegetarian"...i was like "i know" hehe...just cracked me up because I am sure there had been previous misunderstandings.  No matter - don't get me wrong, I LOVE BACON (the candy of meat) but by no means did I miss it or think this delectable concoction needed it in any way.   Moving on to the soup...I am not usually a fan of cold soup, but oh my goodness, I couldn't get enough of this stuff.  There was something sweet in it that I coudn't quite nail down. Bell pepper?  Dunno...I knew this place was a 5 star, but needed some time to work into it.  Service again was fast, carefully prepared, and personal...there were obviously people in line who go several times a week, who Dennis and the staff were quite chatty with but even though I was a newbie, I didn't feel neglected.  Keep up the good work!  Next time I need to try the desserts and ades which look amazing too.
author: Urbo O.
